com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm
Class Credential

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm.Credential

public class Credential
extends java.lang.Object

Credential abstraction. When persisted by the recipient, all attribute values are set. When we use a certificate in a show-proof on the verifier side, the attribute values must be nullified.

Nested Class Summary
 class Credential.UpdateInformation
          Update information needed to update the signature.

Constructor Detail

Credential

public Credential(java.net.URI theCredStructLocation,
                  java.math.BigInteger theCapA,
                  java.math.BigInteger theE,
                  java.math.BigInteger theV,
                  java.util.Vector<Attribute> theAttributes,
                  java.lang.String theName)
Constructor used for loading credential from XML.

Parameters:
theCredStructLocation - Location of the credential structure.
theCapA - Signature value A.
theE - Signature value e.
theV - Signature value v.
theAttributes - Attribute values.
theName - Credential identifier.

Credential

public Credential(java.net.URI theCredStructLocation,
                  java.math.BigInteger theCapA,
                  java.math.BigInteger theE,
                  java.math.BigInteger theV,
                  Values values,
                  MasterSecret masterSecret)
Constructor. Create a credential object. Input is a CL signature (A,e,v), a credential structure (containing issuer public key, group parameters, ...) and the values that will be assigned to the attributes in the newly created credential.

Parameters:
theCredStructLocation - Location of the credential structure.
theCapA - Signature value A.
theE - Signature value e.
theV - Signature value v.
values - Values of the attributes that will be contained in the credential.
masterSecret - Master secret object.

getAttributes

public final java.util.Vector<Attribute> getAttributes()
Returns the set of attributes of this credential. Note that the master secret is not part of this set.

Set of attributes.
